titleInfo.title: Tennessee farm and home science, progress report 28, October - December 1958

mods.abstract: Quarterly newsletter from Knoxville, Tennessee, covering farming and home economics.
mods.tableOfContents: Visitors use radioisotopes in animal nutrition - Situation and outlook on small-scale farms - New bulletins - Personnel changes - New entomology-plant pathology building - Making and merchandising cheddar cheese - Various silages with limited concentrates make economical finishing rations for beef heifer calves - Some Tennessee nurserymen are using irrigation systems - Rinsing and sterilizing teat cups to control mastitis - How to control the strawberry rootworm - Stain removal

originInfo.publisher: University of Tennessee (Knoxville campus). Agricultural Experiment Station

mods.note: Digitized with support from a Project Ceres grant. Project Ceres is a collaboration between the United States Agricultural Information Network (USAIN), the Agriculture Network Information Collaborative (AgNIC) and the Center for Research Libraries (CRL) to support ongoing preservation and digitization of collections in the field of agriculture.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections
